questions.question: 1. How does your trailer respond when you turn the wheel to the right while backing?
answers: You should never turn your wheel while backing

questions.question: 2. What is a key reason backing is so dangerous?
answers: Backing tends to cause damage to accelerators
Backing requires you get out of your tractor; you could be struck by another vehicle
Sticking you head out the window can lead to chronic neck and back pain
Backing gives you limited visibility, you will always have a blind spot
questions.correctAnswer: Backing gives you limited visibility, you will always have a blind spot

questions.question: 3. What is the acronym commonly used to remember the safety check you should perform before backing?
4. If you can use a spotter when backing:
answers: Responsibility for any incidents that occur transfers to the spotter
He/She should be behind your vehicle at all times
Using a handbell cell phone to communicate with him/her is best
You must agree on all hand signals before beginning the maneuver
questions.correctAnswer: You must agree on all hand signals before beginning the maneuver

questions.question: 5. Which of the backing techniques is fundamental in learning all other backing maneuvers?
6. What is the key characteristic to the alley dock backing maneuver?
answers: Backing while turning into a space that is 90 degrees to the truck
Backing into a space alongside a dock
Backing for a long distance (over 200 feet)
questions.correctAnswer: Backing while turning into a space that is 90 degrees to the truck

questions.question: 7. Which of the following statements regarding blind-side jackknife backing are true?
answers: Ending up with a greater than 90-degree angle is preferred
Your spotter should be visible at least 25 percent of the time
It is best to stop every few feet to check your clearance or use the assistance of a spotter, if possible
questions.correctAnswer: It is best to stop every few feet to check your clearance or use the assistance of a spotter, if possible

questions.question: 8. What backing maneuver should you use if the trailer did not wind up directly in front of the target?
9. What is something typically unique to loading dock areas you must watch out for when backing?
answers: Unusual clearances around the dock and any nearby barriers
questions.correctAnswer: Unusual clearances around the dock and any nearby barriers

questions.question: 10. When backing in a parking lot, take note of the:
answers: Location of the sun in the sky relative to your mirrors
Position of the entrances and exits
Amount of fuel in your tank
questions.correctAnswer: Position of the entrances and exits
